CAREER SUMMARY
March 2016 to date Evonik Dubai
Position: Head of HR, MEA Region, HR Business Partner EMEA
Head Quartered in Germany, Evonik is a specialty chemicals producer with 2017 global sales of €14 billion
Strategically directed the HR functions across nine regional offices in UAE, Iran, Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Kenya, Ghana, Russia, Turkey, Switzerland, and SA with 500+ employees and a staff budget of 50M Euros.
Manage and develop personnel by executing HRM strategies as well as coordinating HRM practices and processes. Integrate Sub-Saharan region’s HR function into MEA. Streamline HR activities through internal approval processes and recruitment tools. Conduct annual performance and salary process reviews, salary and annual bonus calculations, employee coaching, mentoring, counselling and conflict mediation. Create training and development plans for employees in accordance with relevant business line. Analyse labour codes/legislation in the countries in which the businesses operate.
Key Contributions:
Strategic HR Counselling for EMEA region as well as alignment of platforms.
Supports the President of the Region EMEA/Cluster MEA and his management team in Strategic HR   Counselling and Strategic input on HR topics
Represents the HR function of the region in business-driven projects (e.g. M&A projects).
Spearheaded the development, and execution of a compensation and benefits structure covering Succession Planning, Talents Management, Performance Management, Strategic Workforce Planning, Change Management,  HR Communication, Job Grading, and Salary Bands alignment across the region.
Developed recruitment tool and upgraded regional hiring procedures and employee transfer processes by minimising the cycle time to hire into a new position.
Headed successful recruitment drives; supervised staff on all matters associated with HR administration, HR data maintenance using success factor, (SAP-P63), Workday and employment contract management.
2012 to 2016 Nobel Oil – Baku Azerbaijan
Nobel Oil is a privately owned company operating in the Azerbaijan upstream and downstream Oil & Gas sector.
August 2015 to March 2016
Position: Director, Corporate Human Resources
August 2012 to August 2015
Position: Head of Human Resources Department
Grew the number of employees to 1200 while managing the HR annual budget of $6.2M. Steered all HRM aspects in the corporate offices of seven businesses.
Guided diverse range of businesses on the development of their specific HR strategies, objectives, and KPI’s. Stewarded HR functions in the due diligence processes of acquiring SDL Fabrication Company, setting up of a JV with Wood Group for off shore brownfield engineering, and supporting company tenders on BP’s fabrication and valve maintenance projects. Revised medical insurance packages for the group’s employees and ESS programmes. Analysed labour codes/legislation in the countries in which the businesses operate.
Key Contributions:
Directed and controlled the development and execution of company’s corporate level human resources policies, procedures, strategies, objectives, and KPI’s.
Enriched organisational productivity by endorsing the sharing of HR best practices and lessons learned across the group’s businesses and within relevant departments.
Recognised as “HR Manager of the Year 2015” in Azerbaijan by “The P World” International Company due to leveraging broad scope of industry knowledge.
Sept 2010 to August 2012 Azertelcom
Position: HR Director
Azertelecom LLC is a telecommunications operator in Azerbaijan
Developed HRM, quality assurance and protocol, determined and resolved translation issues. Managed the annual HR budget of $2.6M and sent efficient assistance to the general director in achieving goals.
Established all HRM systems, carrying out policies, and devising internal communication processes. Scheduled an employee satisfaction survey on annul basis. Oversaw the preparation of HR documents in compliance with local law and legislation. Organised and dealt with the quality assurance, translation and protocol group of the company.
Key Contribution:
Increased head count from 25 to 100 within a six-month period while leading the planning, organisation, and implementation of company staffing plan and recruiting.
Analysed and accessed wage and salary reports/surveys and data in order to determine a competitive compensation plan.
Monitored the company “personnel cost” and established a quality assurance and compliance system in the company.
Feb 2007 to May 2010 Kellogg Brown & Root Overseas Operations Limited, (KBR), – Baku, Azerbaijan
Position: Senior. HR Generalist (Head of Department)
KBR supports the energy, hydrocarbon, government services, and civil infrastructure markets.
Planned, updated, and supervised regular tasks to ensure key completion of human resources operations, recruitment, training, employee growth, employee records, and salary administration.
Provided effective support related to compensation and benefits, training, and employee relations to develop HR procedures, devise KBR’s global policies, and upgraded to local legislation. Appealed and retailed high-impact workforce by developing business aspects, allocating work to assigned staff, and supervising subordinates. Established summer student programme, organised AM Cham HR committees, and AM Cham annual survey for the company.
Key Contribution:
Successfully received a grade promotion to senior HR generalist, led high-skilled team of 700 project employees with four direct reports, and managed a HR budget of $1.1M.
Cultivated solid rapport with government, public and community organisations to develop high-impact employee relations environment and attain accurate data.
Controlled all aspects of terminations, employment, vacation, and sick leave matters in line with labour code / law and negotiated employment contracts for promoted employees.
Ensured timely delivery and conclusion of project to head 700-project staff without issues.
Additional Experience
Resourcing Advisor, BP AzSPU, Baku, Azerbaijan
HR Manager, Fircroft Engineering Services, Baku, Azerbaijan
HR Officer/Deputy HR Manager, Bechtel International, Baku, Azerbaijan
COMMENT
Versatile, results-driven manager with 15+ years of experience in aligning business needs with human capital strategy through visionary, goal-focused HR management. Participative leadership style in fast-paced environments to accomplish functions, including organisational development and design, staff efficiency and employee retention. Unique team building and consultancy proficiency on personnel issues, administrative functions, and legal matters. Multilingual with fluency in Azeri, Russian, English and good at Turkish.
Proven expertise in:
Staff Recruitment Engagement & Retention
Team Leadership & Training
Employee Performance Appraisal
Compensation & Benefits Development
Company Policies Development
Exceptional Communications
Employment Law Proficiency
Health and Safety Regulations
Technical Proficiency
Microsoft Office System, Microsoft Windows XP Professional, , Corel Draw, SAP, VURV, Success Factor, Navision and VISIO
